title: Incident Response & Production Readiness
overview: Handle production incidents effectively with clear procedures, runbooks, and post-mortem analysis.

sections.title: Incident Management
sections.content:
# Incident Response

## The 3 Phases

### 1. Detection
- Monitoring alerts
- User reports
- Automated health checks

### 2. Response
1. Assess severity
2. Page on-call engineer
3. Start incident log
4. Investigate & mitigate
5. Communicate status

### 3. Recovery
- Restore service
- Verify functionality
- Document timeline
- Post-mortem (blameless!)

## Severity Levels

- **P0 (Critical)**: Service down, data loss
- **P1 (High)**: Major functionality broken
- **P2 (Medium)**: Minor issues, workarounds exist
- **P3 (Low)**: Cosmetic, future improvements

## Production Readiness

- [ ] Monitoring & alerting
- [ ] Automated backups
- [ ] Health checks
- [ ] Documentation (runbooks)
- [ ] Rollback procedures
- [ ] Security hardening
- [ ] Load testing
- [ ] Disaster recovery plan

miniProject.title: Production Readiness Checklist
miniProject.description: Create comprehensive incident response plan and production checklist

questions.question: What is a runbook?
questions.explanation: Runbooks document procedures for handling operational tasks and incidents.

questions.question: What is P0 severity?
questions.explanation: P0 is highest severity: service down, data loss, major business impact.

questions.question: Post-mortem should include?
questions.explanation: Post-mortems are blameless: focus on what happened, why, and how to prevent it.

questions.question: First step in incident response?
questions.explanation: First assess severity to determine appropriate response level and escalation.

questions.question: Why are post-mortems blameless?
questions.correctAnswer: To encourage honest discussion of what went wrong without fear of punishment, enabling learning and systemic improvements
questions.explanation: Blameless culture encourages learning from failures to improve systems.

troubleshooting.issue: During incident: unclear what to do
troubleshooting.solution: Follow runbook procedures. If none exist, document actions as you take them for future runbook.
Follow checklist: 1) Breathe 2) Assess 3) Communicate 4) Mitigate 5) Document. Have printed checklist ready.
